infos.info: Sound Effects: Don Foster (Mutual) - Terrace reports broadcast history includes 1933 (NBC). - --------------------------------------------------------------- - Programs began with crown noises and a gavel being hit. During the cases, the bailiff would say in a deep voice ' Step down' - Source: Buxton and Owen, ' The Big Broadcast: 1920-1950'

synopses.synopsis: Famous Jury Trials was billed as 'the dramatic story of our courts, where rich and poor alike, guilty and innocent, stand before the bar of justice.' That said, the listener was taken into the courtroom, where a judge was instructing a jury: Be just and fear not, for the true administration of justice is the foundation of good government. - On the Air: The Encyclopedia of Old-Time Radio by John Dunning
